The Zone-Based Monthly Pass for 3-4 zones seems like a great option for you.

**Monthly Savings:**
By switching to the Zone-Based Monthly Pass, you'll save $10 per month compared to your current transportation costs. This meets your goal of reducing your transportation expenses by $20, and you'll still have an additional $10 to allocate to other expenses or savings.

**Benefits:**

1. **Cost savings**: You'll save $10 per month, which can add up to $120 per year.
2. **Convenience**: With a monthly pass, you won't need to worry about buying individual tickets or daily passes.
3. **Unlimited rides**: Within the 3-4 zone range, you can take unlimited rides during the validity period, which can be useful for personal trips or unexpected travel needs.
4. **Flexibility**: If your commute changes or you need to travel to other zones, you can still use your monthly pass without incurring additional costs.

**Next Steps:**

1. **Purchase the Zone-Based Monthly Pass**: You can buy the pass online, at a train station, or through the transit agency's mobile app.
2. **Set up auto-renewal**: Consider setting up auto-renewal to ensure your pass is renewed automatically each month.
3. **Monitor your expenses**: Keep track of your transportation costs to ensure you're meeting your savings goal.

By making this switch, you'll not only save money but also enjoy the convenience and flexibility of a monthly pass. Congratulations on taking control of your transportation expenses!
